title: Ticket #5276: ipv6 debug messages leaking into stderr of tools
description:
Dimitri reports on htcondor-users list: 

Got this e-mail from a cron job that submits a dag to condor:

> I am: hostname: irukandji, fully qualified doman name: irukandji.bmrb.wisc.edu, IP: 144.92.167.235, IPv4: 144.92.167.235, IPv6:
> I am: hostname: irukandji, fully qualified doman name: irukandji.bmrb.wisc.edu, IP: 144.92.167.235, IPv4: 144.92.167.235, IPv6:

Command it should run is

condor_submit_dag -maxjobs X -maxidle Y -notification Always <file>

-- is that leaking log messages to stdout/stderr?

Debug messages in library code linked with tools should not be D_ALWAYS unless they are errors that the user should always see. In the case above, the debug message is not an error, and thus it should be D_HOSTNAME.
